intro: Sebastiania nervosa, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has alternate, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Sebastiania nervosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil.
